Results.name: Wong International Centre
funfacts: The Wong International Centre launched in 1997
The WIC facilities (kitchen, living & dining area, meeting room) are available for use, to all members of the Acadia University Community.

Wong International Centre was launched with the generous support of Gene D. Wong ('49), Acadia’s first graduate of Chinese descent, to provide support and information for Acadia’s many international students.
The Centre offers Wifi, a study room, and a kitchen where you can cook your favourite foods from home. You can also book the Centre to host an event.
The Hayward House is getting new steps installed!
Results.address: 27 Acadia Street, Wolfville, NS, Canada, Nova Scotia

Results.name: Vaughan Memorial Library
funfacts: This is Acadia’s main library
The library offers many services, such as group meeting rooms and online support

Opened in 1965, the Vaughan was ‘a dream come true.’ Utilizing the steep slope on which it was built, it also boasted ‘the latest developments in functional library design and layout’ (Acadia Bulletin, December 1965).
The library can accommodate 350,000 volumes and 900 readers throughout its five floors
Acadia's library collection has been housed in the Vaughan Memorial Library since 1965,
Results.address: 50 Acadia Street, Wolfville, Nova Scotia, B4P 2R6

Results.name: Hayward House
funfacts: This house houses Acadia's recruitment offices.
This building is a heritage site.
The Hayward House is right across the street from the BAC.
The Hayward House was formerly owned by the West family.

Results.name: Manning Memorial Chapel
funfacts: Bell rings at 11:20 and 11:29 am, and 6:15 pm each weekday to call us to Chapel services.

The university prayer: Lord God of all wisdom, we pray for Acadia University, that she may be faithful to the purposes of our founders, continue to promote the search for truth and knowledge, and be an inspiration to others who follow. May we be a community of scholar's sharing this ambition, caring for one another and loyal to the truth revealed to us by Christ Jesus. Amen

The stained glass windows in the Manning Memorial Chapel present the same pattern to worshippers whether light is behind them or shining upon them. This beauty was the result of careful planning by the master craftsman Henry Lee Willet.
This chapel boasts a 20-stop classical organ that was built by Casavant Freres of Québec, and was dedicated to the University’s War Dead on August 16, 1963.
The church spire, with a six-foot cross covered with gold leaf, towers 198 feet above sea level.
Results.address: Manning Memorial Chapel, 45 Acadia St, Wolfville, NS B4P 2P7

Results.name: Whitman House
funfacts: Whitman House also goes by Tully House!
Whitman is one of eleven residences at Acadia University
Whitman House is the only single gendered residence at Acadia
This is the second oldest residence at Acadia
As of 2019, Tully can house 98 women in single and double rooms, and the building features a main lounge, quiet lounge, two kitchens, two television rooms, and two laundry rooms.

Optimistically, it was planned to be complete for the new school year in the Fall of 1914, but construction fell behind. This did not deter 44 female students from moving into the residence during the first winter despite the ongoing construction.

Results.name: Seminary House
funfacts: Seminary House was founded in 1987
It is a late nineteenth-century, four-storey, wooden structure with Second Empire architectural features.
The Acadia Seminary building is valued for its unique architecture, its association with the history of Acadia University, its association with the history of women’s education at
This building was Designed by Andrew Dewar

Established by progressive Baptist leaders in order to give young women more educational opportunities, the Seminary is the oldest structure in Canada used to house women pursuing post-secondary education.

Results.name: Raymond House
funfacts: It was built in 1927
It was named in honor of Clara Belle Marshall Raymond, the first woman to graduate from Acadia, Class of 1884.
It houses the print shop in the basement and mature students on the top two floors.
Raymond House houses SteamSpace, a program founded in 2013 that teaches students about near horizon technologies, technologies that will start to have an impact in the next two, three or five years,

Results.name: Fountain Commons
funfacts: This building is named after Sheldon L. Fountain
All new students take their ID photos here on their first day on campus!
The Fountain Commons holds many local events.

Results.name: Chipman House
funfacts: The Chipman House stands as a living tribute to the illustrious Ward Chipman, a Loyalist luminary whose indelible mark on Nova Scotia's early history is etched in its very bricks.
Emerging from the sands of time in 1829, the Chipman House has gracefully donned many hats, each one adding a layer of character and intrigue to its storied existence.
Step into a vibrant tapestry of diversity and inclusivity that defines the Chipman House. It's more than just a residence; it's a thriving community where connections and friendships bloom.

Imagine a place where your passions come to life, where your interests become your compass. The Chipman House boasts four distinct communities, each a treasure trove for students with kindred spirits.

Behold the Chipman House, a masterpiece of Georgian architecture that exudes timeless elegance. Its symmetrical façade, brick embrace, and intricate detailing weave a historical and architectural narrative, enhancing the enchantment of Acadia's campus.

Results.name: Willett House
funfacts: The Acadia Divinity College occupeid the Willet House while thier building was being renovated.
This building opened as new residence in 1915 as Acadia was exploding in student numbers.
Open Acadia, the online course services from Acadia, is hosted in Willet House.

The Willett House Award is provided annually to a returning student who is a resident of any house and exhibits house spirit while maintaining a satisfactory academic standing and who has contributed to university or community life through extra-curricular activities. The award was made possible through the initiative of the 1997/1998 Willett House Residence Council.

Results.name: Beveridge Arts Centre
funfacts: Welcome to our artistic oasis, where the pulse of creativity reverberates through every corner. Our university's Arts Building isn't just a place; it's a portal to inspiration.

Step into a world where knowledge meets imagination, where the hallowed halls of our library cradle centuries of wisdom, while the art gallery ignites the senses with a kaleidoscope of colors and concepts.

The Beveridge Arts Centre pulsates with creativity, housing captivating auditoriums and studios where a vibrant array of performances and classes come to life. Here, the stage is set for musical symphonies, mesmerizing dance recitals, and thought-provoking lectures.

Stepping inside, you'll discover an artistic haven — a sprawling art gallery that doubles as a canvas for students, esteemed faculty, and visiting artists. This luminous space isn't just for insiders; it throws open its doors to the public, curating exhibitions that illuminate the academic calendar.
There are over 3,000 works of art in the permanent collection of the Acadia University Art Gallery.

Results.name: Centre for Organizational Research & Development
funfacts: Much research goes on here!
COR&D examines organizational relationships through topics such as burnout, civility in the workplace

Results.name: Students’ Centre (Old and New SUB)
funfacts: Nestled at the heart of Acadia University's campus, the Students' Union Building on Highland Avenue in Wolfville, Nova Scotia, buzzes with activity. Owned and operated by the Acadia Students' Union (ASU), this central hub is home to a variety of ASU-run services and offices, making it a vital part of campus life.

Inside this dynamic building, students can find a range of essential services and unique amenities. From the convenient Union Market store to Perkin's Cafe, named in honor of Acadia University's 12th President, students have access to a diverse array of options. Cajuns Clothing Store, the Axe Lounge, and the Sexual Health Resource Centre add to the vibrant mix of offerings

The Students' Union Building is more than just a collection of services; it's also a center for student engagement. It houses the ASU Executive offices and serves as the headquarters for all Internal Organizations. Additionally, it's where the university's Residence Life office can be found.

The revamped Axe Lounge is envisioned as more than just a bar; it will be a dynamic student hub with extended hours, bolstered services, and a relocated kitchen. Offering a full menu during the day, it will not only enhance the student experience but also create increased job opportunities for fellow students.

The decision to proceed with this renovation was made through a referendum during the 2016 ASU General Election, which received overwhelming support from the student body. Construction commenced in April 2016, and the aim is to help cover the costs through a slight increase in union fees, ensuring a vibrant and inclusive space for all students.

Results.name: Acadia Divinity College
funfacts: Acadia Divinity College, located in the picturesque town of Wolfville, Nova Scotia, is a renowned institution dedicated to theological education and ministerial training.

With a rich history dating back to 1838, Acadia Divinity College has been a steadfast beacon of Christian scholarship, providing students with a strong foundation in theology, ministry, and biblical studies.

One of the unique aspects of Acadia Divinity College is its commitment to fostering a close-knit and supportive community of faith, where students can engage in meaningful dialogue and spiritual growth.
The college's faculty members are renowned scholars and experienced ministers who provide expert guidance, mentorship, and theological insight to students, ensuring a well-rounded education.

Through its commitment to academic excellence and spiritual formation, Acadia Divinity College continues to play a vital role in preparing individuals to make a positive impact in churches, communities, and the world.

Results.name: Wheelock Dining Hall/Campus Bookstore
funfacts: The meal hall features a diverse menu with international cuisines, reflecting the multicultural backgrounds of the student body.
Both the meal hall and bookstore support sustainability efforts by offering eco-friendly products, recycling programs, and locally sourced food options.
The Wheelock Dining Hall offers hours, daily menus, event information and more on their website. At dineoncampus.ca
Wheelock's daily menus offer many food items in diverse food groups
The Campus Bookstore fosters sustainability by allowing you to return books after your done for some money back, and then they sell it at a reduced cost the upcoming year!

Results.name: Central Heating Plant & Tank Farm
funfacts: This building holds tanks full of fuel to heat the whole university!
This is the central heating place for the whole univsersity!

The Central heating Plant is connected to a distribution network, which includes an extensive network of pipes to the buildings it serves. This network is designed to efficiently distribute the heat to different locations.
This building lives on Elm street, the only other building on there is the DeWolfe building
This building is rarely visited by students.
This building is across the field from the Athletics complex, if you look for the smoke stacks, you'll see it.

Results.name: DeWolfe Building
funfacts: The Dewolfe building hosts the Wolfville Farmers market every Saturday 8:30am - 1pm
The Wolfville Farmers market is hosted here and has many great local eats and arts!
On the far side of the DeWolfe building is the harvest valley trail, a great multiuse trail that goes to Kentville and beyond!

Results.name: SRMK Outdoor Activity Centre
funfacts: This is the first building up Highland Avenue from meal hall
It holds a lot of the gear for the outdoor activities held at Acadia University
It most popularly holds the equipment for the high ropes course at the top of University street.

Results.name: Crowell Tower
funfacts: Crowell Tower also goes by just Tower.
Crowell Tower is the tallest building on campus.
Crowell can hold up to 260 Residences
Crowell Tower has a large sports area behind it with basketball courts, tennis courts, skatepark, soccer fields and more!
This building has 13 floors and can be seen from anywhere in Wolfville, if you get lost, just look up!

Results.name: Godfrey House
funfacts: Godfrey House is right across from the BAC!
Godfrey House is one of the smallest buildings on campus
Staff used to live in the Godfrey house, some for more than 15 years!

Results.name: Bancroft House
funfacts: Bancroft House houses many offices for Acadia's support staff

Equity, Diversity and Inclusion Officer Polly Leonard's office is in Bancroft House and it is a confidential, safe space where members of the Acadia community can explore and discuss anything related to harassment and discrimination on campus.
Bancroft House is in between meal hall and the BAC, the busiest street on campus!

Results.name: Dennis House
funfacts: Dennis House is one of the main residences for first year students.

Results.name: Chase Court
funfacts: Chase Court is majorily a second year residence.
Chase Court is the closest building to meal hall. Very useful on snowy days!
Chase Court has a lovely design featuring many large glass walls, from ground to ceiling

Results.name: Acadia Athletics Complex
funfacts: The Acadia Athletics Complex offers a full gym free for all Acadia students.
This building houses Acadia's swimming pool
The Acadia Athletics Complex houses many sports such as swimming, basketball, soccer, hockey, squash and more!
Students can watch our teams play here free! Check Acadia's website for schedules.
The Acadia Athletics Complex offers many free intermurals for students!

Results.name: Carnegie Hall
funfacts: Carnegie Hall is the computer science building!

Results.name: K.C. Irving Centre
funfacts: The K.C. Irving Centre is known as one of the most beautiful buildings on campus.
K.C. Irving Centre has a wonderful botanical garden that connects to many paths, lots to explore!

Results.name: Cutten House
funfacts: The Cutten House is noe of the most popular residences for first year students.

Results.name: War Memorial House
funfacts: Another name for this building is Barracks
